title: How to Make a Marzipan Menagerie

steps.headline: Using brown Marzipan construct a head, arms, legs and a torso.
steps.description: Using undyed marzipan, construct face, ears, hands, and feet. With any excess brown marzipan, mould eyes for your monkey.

steps.headline: Attach monkey's arms and legs to torso.
Attach face and ears to monkey head.
steps.description: Gently Press hands and feet to Monkey arms and legs.

steps.headline: Press eyes to monkey's face, attach head to body, and fix monkey in a sitting position.
Use grey Marzipan to mold ears, 4 legs, a tail, a trunk, a torso, and a head.
Attach legs and tail to elephant's torso in a sitting position.
steps.description: Also mold trunk and ears to the elephant's head.

steps.headline: Fix the elephant head onto the body, and using black Marzipan mold two eyes and attach them on.
Mold a short tail, 4 legs, a torso, a neck, and a head.
Attach legs to torso (see tips), attach head to neck.
steps.description: Let dry(to harden legs into place).

steps.headline: Attach neck to torso and tail to back.
Use brown Marzipan to mold eyes and spots.
steps.description: Make spots abstract and slightly squared, in different sizes.

steps.headline: Create a torso, tail, 4 legs, a turnip-shaped head, and a lion's mane using undyed Marzipan.
Stick tail and legs to torso and wrap lion's mane around the head.
steps.description: Set lion in a lying position.

steps.headline: Attach head to torso, and using any excess brown Marzipan make two eyes and a nose.
steps.description: Gently press eyes and nose on.

text: Monkey Using brown Marzipan construct a head, arms, legs and a torso. Using undyed marzipan, construct face, ears, hands, and feet. With any excess brown marzipan, mould eyes for your monkey. Attach monkey's arms and legs to torso.  Attach face and ears to monkey head. Gently Press hands and feet to Monkey arms and legs. Press eyes to monkey's face, attach head to body, and fix monkey in a sitting position.  Refrigerate.  Elephant Use grey Marzipan to mold ears, 4 legs, a tail, a trunk, a torso, and a head.  Attach legs and tail to elephant's torso in a sitting position. Also mold trunk and ears to the elephant's head. Fix the elephant head onto the body, and using black Marzipan mold two eyes and attach them on.  Refrigerate.  Giraffe Mold a short tail, 4 legs, a torso, a neck, and a head.  Attach legs to torso (see tips), attach head to neck. Let dry(to harden legs into place). Attach neck to torso and tail to back.  Use brown Marzipan to mold eyes and spots. Make spots abstract and slightly squared, in different sizes. Refrigerate.  Lion Create a torso, tail, 4 legs, a turnip-shaped head, and a lion's mane using undyed Marzipan.  Stick tail and legs to torso and wrap lion's mane around the head. Set lion in a lying position. Attach head to torso, and using any excess brown Marzipan make two eyes and a nose. Gently press eyes and nose on. Refrigerate.
